projects.title: LUMA
projects.shortDescription: Custom ATS
projects.description: Fully customized fully functional ATS system made for the archimedes society at VT to counter scheduling difficulties and additional requested functionality. Did this completely on my own

projects.title: Supabase-Flutter Quickstart
projects.shortDescription: Creating a generalized quickstart for Supabase authentication, edge functions, and Flutter.
projects.description: Developed a comprehensive quickstart guide for integrating Supabase authentication and edge functions with Flutter applications. This project aims to streamline the setup process for developers looking to utilize Supabase in their Flutter projects. Particulary, I made it so for my personal projects like Hackathons have a easy starting point.

projects.title: Portfolio Website Revamp
projects.shortDescription: Personal portfolio website built with SvelteKit, Markdown, mdsvex, and TailwindCSS
projects.description: Created a modern portfolio website using SvelteKit for the framework, Markdown for content management, and TailwindCSS for styling. The site features a clean, responsive design with dark/light theme support and smooth page transitions. Built to showcase my projects and skills in an organized way.

projects.title: SteerClear
projects.shortDescription: Walking at night is dangerous - why not have waze for walking, using croudsourced reports?
projects.description: Won 'Best Startup Hack' at Hackviolet. Created SteerClear to address the safety concerns of walking at night, particularly for college students aged 18-24. The app uses crowdsourced data to identify and recommend the safest walking routes, similar to how Waze works for driving. Features include an interactive map with community threat/safety markers, smart route planning, panic button, heat map of reported incidents, group walk system, college selection, and alternate transportation recommendations. Built with Expo React Native and styled with NativeWind, using Supabase for serverless backend and real-time database updates. Integrated MapBox for route visualization, Google Places API for location data, and OpenAI for dynamic threat analysis. The app aims to give everyone peace of mind while walking alone, especially in winter months when it gets dark earlier.

projects.title: Apple Canada Remittance
projects.shortDescription: Revamp existing apple remittance process for Planes to operate with Apple Canada.

projects.title: TrashCash
projects.shortDescription: A mobile app that incentivizes proper waste disposal through gamification and rewards
projects.description: Created a mobile application and IoT device (scanner unit) that encourages recycling by rewarding users with points and achievements. Users can scan waste items, track their environmental impact, and redeem points for rewards. The app includes features like wastebin location finder, points display, and history of items scanned. Built this out with a flutter application, plans for a admin display, an an esp32 scanner unit to go on each bin.

projects.title: RoomReady
projects.shortDescription: Flutter Application to help travellers get connected with locals. Locals eventually are the travellers, and this exchange of information is important in order for both parties to have the best travel experiences.This app connects them, helps plans trips, alongside other features powered by the collection of data from conversations. Built with flutter, supabase, and amazon EC2.

projects.title: Inflectors Project
projects.shortDescription: Participated in CIA pilot project which involved series of weekly cryptograhy puzzles.
projects.description: Completed a total of 10 puzzles, which were a series of weekly cryptography puzzles. All were in depth and challenging, each one taking multiple hours to complete. Finsihed within the top ten of the leaderboard, in which points were earned by completeing the puzzles and being the quickest to complete them. Learned many cryptography tactics and concepts.

projects.title: Website Creation
projects.shortDescription: Personal portfolio website built with markdown after exploring various website creation tools
projects.description: Played around with a bunch of different options to make the website. Tried out Jekyll, which I did not like, used Weebly on Porkbun to make it no-code (which felt clunky), and considered using Hugo. In the end, I decided to just go with plain old markdown, and maybe add a nicer looking theme at the completion of writing the raw markdown.

projects.title: AdaptiveSpec Logistics
projects.shortDescription: Web scraping tool to enhance specialized logistics.
projects.description: Created a web scraping tool specifically for specialized logistics. Built framework where selected companies were added to a personal/company-wide database, which then pushed those selections to the top of the searches. Did not complete but want to add an ML model to learn through user interaction with the application and push certain traits up further on results, which will end up being a future project.
projects.type: Solo Project in a Team Competition

projects.title: Student Health Tracker
projects.shortDescription: Location based early diagnosis and health education tool.
projects.description: Competing in Microsoft's Imagine Cup. Our team is still in prototyping.

projects.title: SeeFood
projects.shortDescription: AI-powered cooking assistant with voice commands built in Unity
projects.description: Worked in a team of four to make a tool which was an AI cooking assistant. It provided feedback on a wide variety of inputs, such as cooking time, and if items were spoiled or not. I primarily worked on the UI in Unity and made the dictation tool to enable voice commands, which then communicated with our backend to provide the requested service.

projects.title: Harvard's CS50
projects.shortDescription: Taking Harvard's introductory computer science course to strengthen CS fundamentals
projects.description: Working to strengthen foundational Computer Science concepts. Following along with the phenomenal lectures from David J. Malan, and completing the problem sets to earn my CS50 completion certificate. worked through weekly psets and lectures to overall get a better grasp of the fundamentals of programming.

projects.title: Sprklii MVP
projects.shortDescription: Date ideas, personalized.
projects.description: Founded an LLC with the idea of bringing personalization to the date ideas scene. Google and other competitors serve people very generalized and blank ideas, and we serve personalized and customized ideas to keep the Spark Alive! I worked as the only developer to get our MVP + alpha product released, and now lead a team with two other developers as we enter our beta phase.

projects.title: Mover's Suite API
projects.shortDescription: Built API connection tools for moving company's management software
projects.description: Created API connection tools for Mover's Suite. These connections enabled continuous data transfer between existing systems, which otherwise was not occuring. This was a great project to work on, and I learned a lot about the inner workings of the software we were using at planes, and also how to properly work with APIs, even if the documentation is lacking.

projects.title: Mover's Suite RPA Status Updates
projects.shortDescription: Automated status update system for moving company operations
projects.description: Developed automated status update system at Planes Moving and Storage. This was a RPA project where I used Power Automate Desktop to stimulate the actions typically required in Mover's Suite to update a status. This project was done because accessing certain things like statuses via the API was extremely difficult, and by using RPA we were able to accomplish a similar effect without usingthe API. Additionally, this served internally as a demo of the possibilities of RPA in conjunction with some of the legacy systems and software in use.

projects.title: Employee Technology Education
projects.shortDescription: Led technical training initiatives for company employees
projects.description: Led employee training and education initiatives at Planes. Training included multiple diferent topics, including Application Lifecycle Management, Microsoft Dataverse, Git, GitHub, and SQL Server. This was a part of a larger initiative to move the company to Microsoft's Power Platform. Inside of the group of dev's, this was a part of an initiative to move our SCM to elsewhere. We were on visual source safe, and I was instrumental in explaining the basics to git and github, and helpign initiate and bring about our migration to using git as our SCM.
links: Contact me for the particular presentations.

projects.title: XPM to Smartsheet Data Connection
projects.shortDescription: Created data integration between XPM and Smartsheet.
projects.description: Built data connection between XPM and Smartsheet at Planes. This data integration was integral, as it allowed us to move data between systems that we were unable to prior to this, and it was done as a manual process prior to the implementation of this system. This system also had to interact with data on an exchange drive. Working on this project taught me a lot about how data flows, and the importance of data integrity. I also learned a lot about how to work with different systems and groups to integrate something that works across multiple teams and functional groups.

projects.title: Project Manager Time Tracking
projects.shortDescription: Developed mobile-friendly time tracking system to replace legacy system
projects.description: Project Manager Time Tracker was a time tracking system to replace our previous system built into XPM. This project recreated the functionality of the previous system so it could be accessed in mobile form, and we also automated and simplified the process while developing the new application.

projects.title: SmartSheet Supplier Information
projects.shortDescription: Centralized supplier information system with automated data entry
projects.description: Smart Sheet Supplier Information was a project to better centralize all of our supplier information in the microsoft ecosystem. Prior to this project everything was in smartsheet and scattered to multiple files and sheets, and this project centralized all of this information, and automated some of the steps in the process of adding information to the database.

projects.title: Apple Remittance Automation
projects.shortDescription: Automated parsing of Apple remittance emails into CSV format
projects.description: This project involved automating the extraction of information from our apple remittances. Apple sends their remittances as text embedded in email, so I had to write an automate to parse the text and save it into a csv so our accounting department could more easily work with it. This way accountants did not need to manually compile this data

projects.title: Warehouse Time Tracking App
projects.shortDescription: Built time tracking application for warehouse operations.
projects.description: Developed warehouse time tracking application at Planes Moving and Storage. This enabled better limits and regulations on data entry, and greatly improved our process for warehouse time entry, and increased the amount of billable time in the warehouse.

projects.title: SOP SharePoint
projects.shortDescription: Created and managed standard operating procedures system in SharePoint
projects.description: Created and managed SOP SharePoint system at Planes Moving and Storage as IT Intern

projects.title: GolfBot MVP
projects.shortDescription: Golf playing robot for those who are physically impaired. Built for May We Help.
projects.description: Developed a specialized robot capable of playing golf to assist individuals with physical impairments. The robot was built for May We Help, a non-profit organization dedicated to creating custom solutions for people with special needs. The system used computer vision to identify golf balls and targets, and featured a mechanical swing mechanism that could be triggered remotely. This project made the sport of golf more accessible to those who otherwise couldn't participate.

projects.title: FictileBot
projects.shortDescription: Starting point for any robot using the Rev/FTC Robotics Framework
projects.description: Created a template repository that serves as the foundation for any FTC robotics project using the REV Robotics framework. This repository contains all the basic configurations, helper functions, and standard implementations needed to quickly start a new robot project. It was successfully used by Team 4969 as the starting point to create their golf bot, demonstrating its effectiveness as a reusable template.

projects.title: Robot-X Computer Vision
projects.shortDescription: Enhanced robotics vision system using dual-channel input with OpenCV
projects.description: Revamped our vision system using OpenCV. This was a pretty widespread project that I did on my own to implement two channels of input rather than just using a single channel of input. Took a huge portion of competition season to complete, but resulted in extremely accurate vision by comparing the channels of input.

projects.title: Robot-X Software Lead
projects.shortDescription: Led robotics software team for 3 years, implementing agile practices
projects.description: Lead software team at Robot-X for three years, with around three members working for me on the subteam. Worked to introduce agile practices into our workflow, and saw efficiency increases due to it. Got a large amount of experience working as both a PM and working directly on some of the more challenging software we needed to write.
links: All repos are private, some samples are on my GitHub.

projects.title: Automatic Garage Door Closer
projects.shortDescription: Built IoT device to automatically close garage doors using Arduino
projects.description: Created an automatic garage door closing system that physically pressed the garage door button when the garage door was left open for too long. Used two radio transceivers, an ultrasonic sensor, and a servo to put together the physical product to accompany the software I made.
links: Contact me for the specific files

projects.title: Kids Like Food 2
projects.shortDescription: First programming project - food blog built with HTML/CSS
projects.description: Learned the basics of HTML and CSS as a starting project to make a food blog with a friend. Used Google Docs as version control and learned fundamental programming practices.
